data.name: Virtual Accounts
data.description: HSBC offers two types of Virtual Accounts (VA): (1) Traditional VA - A unique reference number in the format of a BSB and account number that payors can use to make a payment to help Wholesale banking customers with payor identification; (2) Next Generation Virtual Account Management - A solution that can help reduce the number of physical bank accounts held by the customer and streamline bank account management and reconciliation activities

features.additionalValue: There is no limit to the number of transactions that can be made into the virtual account

Applicable to Next Generation Virtual Account Management only. User interface is accessible through HSBCnet. Enables customer to visualise virtual account balances, self-manage certain virtual account parameters (open/close, rename virtual accounts), download virtual account reporting.

features.additionalInfo: Virtual account transactions are identifiable in the regular bank statement. However, a dedicated report for receipts, including receipts into a virtual account, is available as an optional feature.

fees.name: Maintenance fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applicable to Traditional VA and Next Generation Virtual Account Management

fees.name: Transaction fee - Traditional VA
fees.additionalValue: Fee charged for each transaction made into a virtual account. This is  charged in addition to the usual transaction fees.

fees.name: Establishment Fee - Next Generation Virtual Account Management
Maintenance fee - Next Generation Virtual Account Management
fees.additionalValue: Monthly fee per virtual account. This is charged in addition to the maintenance fee for the physical account.
fees.additionalInfo: $1 per virtual account, subject to a minimum charge of $300.
